imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear

Class ProjectiveMapping

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping
      • imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear.LinearMapping
        • imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WarpParameters, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AffineMapping

    public class ProjectiveMapping
extends LinearMapping
implements WarpParameters
    2015-02-16: Added preliminary constructor for more than 4 point pairs (overdetermined, least-squares).

      • ProjectiveMapping

        public ProjectiveMapping(Point2D p0,
                         Point2D p1,
                         Point2D p2,
                         Point2D p3,
                         Point2D q0,
                         Point2D q1,
                         Point2D q2,
                         Point2D q3)
        Creates a new ProjectiveMapping between arbitrary quadrilaterals P, Q.
        Parameters:
        p0 - point 1 of source quad P.
        p1 - point 2 of source quad P.
        p2 - point 3 of source quad P.
        p3 - point 4 of source quad P.
        q0 - point 1 of target quad Q.
        q1 - point 2 of target quad Q.
        q2 - point 3 of target quad Q.
        q3 - point 4 of target quad Q.

      • ProjectiveMapping

        public ProjectiveMapping(Point2D[] P,
                         Point2D[] Q)
        Creates a new ProjectiveMapping between arbitrary quadrilaterals P, Q.
        Parameters:
        P - source quad.
        Q - target quad.

      • ProjectiveMapping

        public ProjectiveMapping(Point2D[] P,
                         Point2D[] Q,
                         boolean dummy)
        Constructor for more than 4 point pairs, finds a least-squares solution for the homography parameters. NOTE: this is UNFINISHED code!
        Parameters:
        P - sequence of points (source)
        Q - sequence of points (target)
        dummy - unused (only to avoid duplicate signature)
